SEARCH
Package com.visionreport.api

Class Test

java.lang.Object
com.visionreport.api.Test
public final class Test extends Object
Represents a single test case within the Vision Report framework.

Each Test instance encapsulates all relevant information about a specific test case, including metadata (authors, categories), execution timing, and an ordered collection of Log entries representing test steps or checkpoints.

The class provides a fluent interface for logging events of various Status levels (PASS, FAIL, INFO, SKIP) and attaching media or exceptions to each log entry.

Example Usage: 

 VisionReport report = new VisionReport();
 
 report.createTest("Login Test").assignAuthor("Deepak").assignCategory("Smoke", "UI")
                .log(Status.INFO, "Open Browser", "Launching Chrome browser")
                .log(Status.PASS, "Login", "User logged in successfully")
                .logException(new RuntimeException("Dashboard timeout"));
Since:
1.0
Version:
1.4
Author:
Deepak

    • log

      public Test log(Status status, String name, String details, MediaProvider media)
      Logs an event with a name, details, and optional attached media.
      Parameters:
      status - The Status of the log event. Must not be null.
      name - The title or name of the log step.
      details - A detailed description for the log.
      media - Optional media to attach, created via MediaProvider.fromPath(String)
      Returns:
      The current Test instance for fluent chaining.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if status is null.
